segment.source: Customize Windows 10 Start with ICD and provisioning packages (Windows 10)
segment.target: Customize Windows 10 Start with ICD and provisioning packages (Windows 10)

segment.source: In Windows 10, you can use a provisioning package to deploy a customized Start layout to users.
segment.target: In Windows 10, you can use a provisioning package to deploy a customized Start layout to users.

segment.source: Customize Windows 10 Start with ICD and provisioning packages
segment.target: Customize Windows 10 Start with ICD and provisioning packages

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Looking for consumer information?
segment.target: Looking for consumer information?

segment.source: Customize the Start menu
segment.target: Customize the Start menu

segment.source: In Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, you can use a provisioning package that you create with Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) tool to deploy a customized Start layout to users.
segment.target: In Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Education, you can use a provisioning package that you create with Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) tool to deploy a customized Start layout to users.

segment.source: No reimaging is required, and the Start layout can be updated simply by overwriting the .xml file that contains the layout.
segment.target: No reimaging is required, and the Start layout can be updated simply by overwriting the .xml file that contains the layout.

segment.source: The provisioning package can be applied to a running device.
segment.target: The provisioning package can be applied to a running device.

segment.source: This enables you to customize Start layouts for different departments or organizations, with minimal management overhead.
segment.target: This enables you to customize Start layouts for different departments or organizations, with minimal management overhead.

segment.source: Before you begin: Customize and export Start layout
segment.target: Before you begin: Customize and export Start layout

segment.source: How Start layout control works
segment.target: How Start layout control works

segment.source: Two features enable Start layout control:
segment.target: Two features enable Start layout control:

segment.source: The Export-StartLayout cmdlet in Windows PowerShell exports a description of the current Start layout in .xml file format.
segment.target: The Export-StartLayout cmdlet in Windows PowerShell exports a description of the current Start layout in .xml file format.

segment.source: Start layout can only be applied to a device using the same architecture (32-bit or 64-bit) as the device on which Start layout was created.
segment.target: Start layout can only be applied to a device using the same architecture (32-bit or 64-bit) as the device on which Start layout was created.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: To import the layout of Start to a mounted Windows image, use the Import-StartLayout cmdlet.
segment.target: To import the layout of Start to a mounted Windows image, use the Import-StartLayout cmdlet.

segment.source: In ICD, you use the Start/StartLayout setting to set the path to the .xml file that defines the Start layout.
segment.target: In ICD, you use the Start/StartLayout setting to set the path to the .xml file that defines the Start layout.

segment.source: Create a provisioning package that contains a customized Start layout
segment.target: Create a provisioning package that contains a customized Start layout

segment.source: Use the Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) tool included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10 to create a provisioning package that applies a customized Start layout.
segment.target: Use the Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) tool included in the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK) for Windows 10 to create a provisioning package that applies a customized Start layout.

segment.source: Install the ADK.
segment.target: Install the ADK.

segment.source: Open ICD (by default, %systemdrive%Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitImaging and Configuration Designerx86ICD.exe).
segment.target: Open ICD (by default, %systemdrive%Program Files (x86)Windows Kits10Assessment and Deployment KitImaging and Configuration Designerx86ICD.exe).

segment.source: Choose New provisioning package.
segment.target: Choose New provisioning package.

segment.source: Name your project, and click Next.
segment.target: Name your project, and click Next.

segment.source: Choose Common to all Windows desktop editions and click Next.
segment.target: Choose Common to all Windows desktop editions and click Next.

segment.source: On New project, click Finish.
segment.target: On New project, click Finish.

segment.source: The workspace for your package opens.
segment.target: The workspace for your package opens.

segment.source: Expand Runtime settingsStart, and click StartLayout.
segment.target: Expand Runtime settingsStart, and click StartLayout.

segment.source: Specify the path and file name of the Start layout .xml that you created with the Export-StartLayout cmdlet.
segment.target: Specify the path and file name of the Start layout .xml that you created with the Export-StartLayout cmdlet.

segment.source: On the File menu, select Save.
segment.target: On the File menu, select Save.

segment.source: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.
segment.target: On the Export menu, select Provisioning package.

segment.source: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.
segment.target: Change Owner to IT Admin, which will set the precedence of this provisioning package higher than provisioning packages applied to this device from other sources, and then select Next.

segment.source: Optional.
segment.target: Optional.

segment.source: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.
segment.target: In the Provisioning package security window, you can choose to encrypt the package and enable package signing.

segment.source: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.
segment.target: Enable package encryption - If you select this option, an auto-generated password will be shown on the screen.

segment.source: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.
segment.target: Enable package signing - If you select this option, you must select a valid certificate to use for signing the package.

segment.source: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select... and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.
segment.target: You can specify the certificate by clicking Select... and choosing the certificate you want to use to sign the package.

segment.source: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.
segment.target: Click Next to specify the output location where you want the provisioning package to go when it's built.

segment.source: By default, Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) uses the project folder as the output location.
segment.target: By default, Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) uses the project folder as the output location.

segment.source: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.
segment.target: Optionally, you can click Browse to change the default output location.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: Click Build to start building the package.
segment.target: Click Build to start building the package.

segment.source: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.
segment.target: The provisioning package doesn't take long to build.

segment.source: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.
segment.target: The project information is displayed in the build page and the progress bar indicates the build status.

segment.source: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.
segment.target: If you need to cancel the build, click Cancel.

segment.source: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: This cancels the current build process, closes the wizard, and takes you back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.
segment.target: If your build fails, an error message will show up that includes a link to the project folder.

segment.source: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.
segment.target: You can scan the logs to determine what caused the error.

segment.source: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.
segment.target: Once you fix the issue, try building the package again.

segment.source: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.
segment.target: If your build is successful, the name of the provisioning package, output directory, and project directory will be shown.

segment.source: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.
segment.target: If you choose, you can build the provisioning package again and pick a different path for the output package.

segment.source: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.
segment.target: To do this, click Back to change the output package name and path, and then click Next to start another build.

segment.source: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.
segment.target: If you are done, click Finish to close the wizard and go back to the Customizations Page.

segment.source: Copy the provisioning package to the target device.
segment.target: Copy the provisioning package to the target device.

segment.source: Double-click the ppkg file and allow it to install.
segment.target: Double-click the ppkg file and allow it to install.
